name: Heart Beat Family Multi Cuisine Restaurant

reviews.review_text: The Chinese noodles were fine, edible, but the service really disappointed me. Even though there was only one other couple in the restaurant and five staff members present, the service was extremely slow. I had to get up and ask for the bill myself because no one came for so long that my taxi ended up waiting for me. This kind of inattentiveness is unacceptable and overshadowed the overall experience.

The Mix Fried Rice Was Delivered From Swiggy Without Any Prawns, Chicken And Veggies In It. And When i Tried to Discuss this issue with the Heart Beat Restaurant In Mapusa North Goa . They say we don't put veggies In Our Mix Fried Rice. The worst Restaurant You Can't Rely On. Think 1000 Times Before Ordering From Then so That Your Hard Earned Money won't Go waste because of such restaurant. And When i Asked About the veggies in the mix fried Rice, he says you should mention adding veggies in Mix Fried Rice, such a very bad treatment from the restaurant itself to the customer

Had visited the place recently. Had Chicken Pulao and Chicken Dry. Pulao was great, fry chicken was very dry. Service was good.

Old Review: The seating space is great. Great ambience. The fish tank at the entrance looks cool. I stopped coming here 2 years back because I the food used to be average and sometimes inconsistent. Some dishes were below average. Returned here after 2 years. Came here as didn't have any option. I was skeptical at first, the food was nice. The quality of food had improved a lot compared to what I had before.

description:
### Heart Beat Family Multi Cuisine Restaurant: A Heartfelt Experience in Goa

Nestled in the vibrant landscape of Goa, **Heart Beat Family Multi Cuisine Restaurant** has captured the attention of diners with an overall rating of **3.9** from **1,222 reviews**. This eclectic eatery specializes in a diverse range of offerings, with standout mentions including **fish dishes** (27 times), **thalis** (18 mentions), and a notable **Goan cuisine** presence (16 mentions). Despite some mixed reviews, the restaurant remains a point of interest for locals and tourists alike.

#### Ambiance & Design

As you step into Heart Beat, the first thing that greets you is a unique **fish tank at the entrance**, exuding a sense of tranquility and charm. The seating arrangement is spacious, offering a comfortable setting for families and larger gatherings. Reviewers have noted the **bright and engaging décor**, which complements the warm ambiance of the restaurant. However, opinions do vary regarding the noise levels, with a couple of patrons highlighting that it can feel a bit lively, especially during peak hours, but perhaps that's part of the inviting atmosphere. 

#### Menu & Culinary Experience

The menu at Heart Beat is a delightful mix of flavors, with a variety of **Goan dishes**, **Chinese noodles**, and **pulao** that many have described as flavorful. Signature dishes often spotlight **thalis—traditional Indian meal trays**—and the locally-sourced fish options. Customer photos reflect the vibrancy of the dishes served; for instance, the presentation of the chicken pulao is inviting and colorful, while the fried dishes, although visually appealing, received mixed reviews for their consistency. Notably, other diners expressed disappointment over specific orders like the **mixed fried rice**, which came without the expected accompaniments, leading to conversations about ingredient expectations and quality control.

#### Customer Experience & Service

One area that has drawn criticism is the **service quality**. Several reviews indicate a surprising lack of attentiveness from the staff, even during quieter dining times. One customer recounted a scenario where they felt obliged to fetch their own bill due to the slow service. Another remarked on their disappointment with a takeaway order from Swiggy, highlighting communication issues regarding what ingredients were included in the dish. Despite these criticisms, some diners have praised certain staff members for their friendliness and positive service experiences.

#### Popularity & Reviews

Heart Beat has certainly garnered a mixed bag of sentiments from its patrons. Social media and online reviews paint a picture of a restaurant with potential—though currently marred by inconsistent service and dish accuracy. Some headed back after years to find improvement, though others left feeling disillusioned by their experience. A few have taken to recommend the establishment for its improved quality versus past visits, indicating a possible upward trend in its culinary offerings. 

#### Utilizing Visual Content

The array of customer-provided photos contributes substantially to the restaurant’s narrative. From the **vibrant plates of fresh fish and thalis** to the inviting ensemble of the restaurant's interiors, these images amplify the heartwarming goal that Heart Beat strives for. Capturing not just the dishes but the welcoming atmosphere, they beautifully illustrate why this spot holds a special place in the dining scene of Goa.

In summary, Heart Beat Family Multi Cuisine Restaurant stands as a colorful addition to Goa’s culinary tapestry. While it shines in some areas such as ambiance and dish variety, it continues to navigate challenges tied to service consistency and customer expectations. It beckons to those willing to explore the diverse offerings with a hope for delightful experiences—and perhaps even a heartwarming meal by the coastal shores of Goa.
